reviews.sentence: Warm Stay During Snow Storm. Arrived during Sundays snow storm and was welcomed with a speedy check in and warm chocolate chip cookie. Lobby smelled fresh clean. Hotel personnel was prompt in maintaining the lobby floor dry as the snow storm brought in wet shoes floor. Our room was spacious clean and heating unit worked properly which made us feel at home. I did not use the wi fi in the room which cost extra. Instead accessed free wi fi in the hotels public areas lobby gym. Lots of restaurants walking distance. Overall it was a great experience. I plan to return next February.
National volleyball tournament. Location. No wifi.

Great location beds comfy baths blah. The location was perfect 2 blocks from anything we wanted. The baths vent was awful and left a smell in the room not bad but noticeable and not pleasant. The windows had so much condensation it was awful. There was no table in the room brought take out pizza and ate in lobby only had a few tables and couches bar was just there empty nothing but the skeleton. Used the exercise room and it was great.
Central to visit Chicago. Location close to navy pier and downtown Chicago. Swimming pool gym. Wholefods across the street. AC in room is extremely noisy feels like we are in a plane.

Great hotel well worth the money. Great location walking distance of all tourist attractions. Nice gym downstairs in the lobby. Bathroom did not have a vent for some reason and they do not give enough soap it should be body wash.

bugs. Good location and reasonably priced. The restaurant was good and bar staff were friendly and excellent. The gym was never crowded and is modern and well maintained. My stay was spoiled by multiple roaches in the bathroom. They appeared from inside towels on the rack. After going down to let the front desk know about the bugs I ran into another roach right by the elevators. That was enough to make me think they had a significant issue.

Nice hotel close to Michigan Ave shopping. Great location. We asked to be on the highest floor possible and she upgraded us to a room with a view. We walked up Michigan Ave to the Hancock building one day and walked down Michigan Ave to Millennium Park. Very centrally located for a lot of Chicago activities. The hotel had a modern updated look to it. The location is great. Very centrally located to shopping and other attractions. n a.

it is OK. For the price of the room and parking I expected a nicer facility. I have stayed in much nicer for much less but it is downtown. you are staying there for location. The restaurant menu is limited. The fitness center is large and well equipped. This place is average.
Exceptional. staff room fitness center and room service are all excellent. my room service cleaning lady was awesome and made sure the room was cleanparking is too expensive.

Family Trip. The service level at this hotel is poor. They also claim the TVs work and get certain channels. This is not true and we were told is a known problem we would just have to live with it. They barely acknowledge our issue. The check in lady was rude and not helpful. She made me feel like I was bothering her instead of welcoming me as a guest. The location is great for lots of activities but the noise in the morning is very loud and very early.

Good clean hotel conveniently located. I was in town for a conference. The hotel was welcoming and clean. The location was perfect and I was able to get to most attractions by a short walk. The gym is relatively small so consider that in case you are planning a serious work out during your stay.

Volleyball tournament nightmare. My daughters volleyball team blocked rooms at Doubletree by Hilton Chicago Mag Mile. By the time all of the games the team dinner was finished we did not get to the hotel until 945 pm. After I got checked in we went up to our room but neither of the keys would work. I ended up having to go down to the front desk 3 separate times because we could not get in to our room. When maintenance finally got the door open he found luggage sleeping guests. The guests ended up being another volleyball family who booked on Expedia. I understand that hotels overbok but why was I given keys to a room that was given away to someone else. Why was the room still under MY name my credit card. We got a lot of I apologize I understand but the best they could do was pay for our room at a different hotel. Gee thanks. Almost 2 hours after checking in to Doubletree an employee walked us down the street to check us in to Embassy Suites. Embassy Suites is highly recommend. Doubletree by hilton Chicago I do NOT recommend at all.

Underwhelmed. All around disappointed with my stay. Noisy reservation screwed up broken equipment in the fitness room and not providing me with a receipt when originally requested. Disappointed past experiences with Doubletree were much better than this last one.

Stay was great with a lot of things to do within walking distance. Location was great. Lots of activities around the Hotel. Room was great the staff was great. Food drinks in the Hotel were relatively more expensive than the surrounding restaurants and bars. Since I booked on bokingcom instead of hiltoncom I do not get my Hilton Honors Points for the stay. The price was better through bokingcom so I guess that is a wash.

Fair. I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights for my husband and myself and my son for his wedding. My room was as booked a corner king. My son requested a late checkin because of the wedding rehearsal and was told they would save his room also booked as a corner king. I could n’t check him in even though I paid for the room because I booked through bokingcom. My son was given a ‘ king fitness ’ room. It was n’t a king and had exercise equipment in the room. I complained and was told first come first serve and because I booked through booking com I basically did n’t get the same priorities. After more complaining that my son and his wife did n’t want to spend their wedding night in a gym they agreed to move them the next day at noon they got in their room at 2. Continued complaining got me a 50 credit.

Hotel was recently remodeled and the king room we stayed in had a great in room workout area. Stationary bike weights yoga mat balance ball medicine balls and workout videos.

Really liked this hotel and amenities. Staff was excellent location was great for the purpose of my visit. I would have given it a 5 if I did not get a weird theme room the room was half bedroom half workout space.
